Reason: The configuration 'windows_timer_interval' is performance-sensitive. The adjustment of the system timer on Windows from the default 15ms down to the minimum of 1ms directly impacts timer intervals, thread scheduling, driver interrupts, etc. This adjustment can lead to notable performance variations at the system level, affecting latency and throughput. The code context shows that the configuration is triggered during the activation and termination of the daemon, as well as during system startup and shutdown processes. The method 'getWindowsTimerInterval' retrieves the value of 'windows_timer_interval' from the configuration, indicating its significance in controlling system performance.
